intro: Merwia, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the Apocynaceae family. It is native to various regions in Africa, particularly in arid and semi-arid environments. The plants typically have opposite, ovate leaves and produce showy, often pink or white, tubular flowers. They are characterized by their milky sap, which is a common feature among members of the Apocynaceae family. Merwia species are often used in traditional medicine and are also valued for their ornamental appeal.
